intro: Siphonanthus elasticus, commonly known as the elastic siphonanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its climbing habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a legume pod that contains several seeds, and the plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
